sentences.english: The poor old dog hobbled off with his master.
sentences.chinese: 那条可怜的老狗一瘸一瘸地跟着主人走了。

sentences.english: The poor old dog hobbled off with his master.
sentences.chinese: 那条可怜的老狗一瘸一瘸地跟着主人走了。

sentences.english: The gimp went lamely around while whistling, informed us not to go to work.
sentences.chinese: 那个瘸子一瘸一跛地四处吹哨，通知说不出工。

sentences.english: Do not see is, but once up and running, able to feel the lame .
sentences.chinese: 看是看不出，但是一旦跑起来，能感觉到自己瘸了。

sentences.english: She is lamed, leaping over a stile.
There’s a woman who limps as she goes down the stairs ahead of me.
sentences.chinese: 在我前面的一个女人一步一瘸地走下台阶。

sentences.english: Liu Zhenkui will hobble of the dragon, forced him to say black.
sentences.chinese: 陆振魁将瘸龙劫走，逼他说出“黑皮”的下落。

sentences.english: The llama has a lame leg.
sentences.chinese: 那只美洲驼有一只腿瘸。

sentences.english: A lame cat is better than a swift horse when rats infest the palace.
sentences.chinese: 宫殿有鼠患，瘸猫比快马强。

sentences.english: They shut down, becoming suddenly limp and still.
sentences.chinese: 他们停机了，变得又瘸又哑。

sentences.english: The second time when I saw her 10) limping before the 11) crippled.
sentences.chinese: 第二次是看见她在跛子前瘸着腿走。

sentences.english: If you've ever seen a one-legged dog then you've seen me.
sentences.chinese: 你可曾见过一条在街上踽踽独行的瘸狗么？

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
